text: <@U02E3CRMA> and <@U0EL0GLEL> check out rob (IonTank’s note).  first we’re hearing of these plans. my suggesstion is that we jump on a HO to discuss one level deeper.  agree?
basically “sounds good, let’s get on a hangout to review what we have and make sure Kyle’s all set"

I think we will be fine, the software identifies them based on the hardware id of the controller. I am not completely sure about calibration tho. it might just carry over due to the controller not changing. But if they need to do it again its a pretty simple task kyle could be walked throuh
the motor slow-mode is a (minor) change-order to the system scripts
<@U02E3CRMA> - same page.  i think the subtext of response is that any changes require discussion and larger orchestration

yes - since this feature was for the all-open/all-close calls, which call the motor control scripts under the hood. A few lines to change, minor stuff. But we can’t test until we get the new cubby since our motor won’t do it.
which means an incremental bump, build and install a new Debian package
<@U02E3CRMA> is replying to thead, pointing out the code work that would need to be done, and asking to jump on a quick HO.  <@U0EL0GLEL> standby
